result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stefanie L. Hale

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
by DHS
Re: Order for Competency Examination by DHS

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:28 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Peter Vu. 

Date and time set for review of competency. 
COURT recites history. 
Atty Vu advises they are still seeking an order for motion on competency. 
State has no objection. 

COURT reviews Doc 16 (Motion for Competency) and grants motion. 
COURT directs Atty Vu to draft Order for Competency Examination for signature. 

COURT sets review hearing for 12/05/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

Adj: 9:31 a.m.
Review hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:31 pm 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen; Deft is NOT present - Atty Peter Vu appears on deft's behalf. 
Date and time set for hearing to review status of competency. 
COURT notes advocate for deft has indicated deft is ill and unable to appear today. 
Atty Vu has filed motion for competency examination. 
COURT notes need for deft to be present to address motion. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to reset. 
Adj: 3:33 pm
Motion for Competency Examination
Review hearing on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk:  Amy. 
Case called: 10:08 a.m.    
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears in person with Atty Peter Vu. 

Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

Next Hearing >> PTC 7/19/22 at 3:15 p.m. 

Adj:  10:10 a.m.
Preliminary Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:10 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Peter Vu

ADDRESS INFO for Stefanie L. Hale
Current: 3200 Hilltop Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 03-23-2022)
Prior: 512 S 3rd Avenue-5, Wausau, WI 54401

No contact with victim(s): C.M.F.;  N.R.E. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. Prints and photograph. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
